abstract: Connecticut lawmakers pass $626 million economic development package in one-day special session; legislature, with only one dissenting vote in each house, approves a two-year program of hiring incentives, job training and infrastructure repair, with the majority of it intended to help small businesses.
snippet: In Connecticut, a state that has lagged the nation in employment growth, lawmakers cooperated to pass a bill designed to help small businesses.
lead_paragraph: In Connecticut, a state that has lagged the nation in employment growth, lawmakers cooperated to pass a bill designed to help small businesses.

headline.main: Bipartisan Accord in Connecticut Yields a $626 Million Jobs Package
headline.print_headline: Bipartisan Accord in Connecticut Yields a $626 Million Jobs Package
headline.seo: Bipartisan Accord in Connecticut Yields Major Jobs Package
